solution_line_template: Jenson uses {yards_per_shirt} x {jenson_shirts_per_day} = <<{yards_per_shirt}*{jenson_shirts_per_day}={jenson_fabric_per_day}>>{jenson_fabric_per_day} yards of fabric for making shirts every day.

Kingsley uses {kingsley_pants_per_day} x {yards_per_pant} = <<{kingsley_pants_per_day}*{yards_per_pant}={kingsley_fabric_per_day}>>{kingsley_fabric_per_day} yards of fabric every day for making pair of pants.

So, the total yards of fabric they use per day is {kingsley_fabric_per_day} + {jenson_fabric_per_day} = <<{kingsley_fabric_per_day}+{jenson_fabric_per_day}={total_fabric_per_day}>>{total_fabric_per_day}
Therefore, the total yards of fabric they use every {num_days} days is {total_fabric_per_day} x {num_days} = <<{total_fabric_per_day}*{num_days}={total_fabric_3_days}>>{total_fabric_3_days}.
